alert.note: Alert for Hartford; Middlesex (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 18 at 11:24PM EDT until July 19 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut... Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Connecticut... Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Hartford. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Lowland flooding is expected along the Connecticut River from Hartford through Wethersfield and Glastonbury, primarily outside of levee protection. This will affect several riverside roadways as well as several park and recreational facilities. Further downstream flooding is expected in low lying sections along the Connecticut River from Wethersfield and Glastonbury downstream through Cromwell, Middletown and Portland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EDT Tuesday was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 13.1 feet late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.9 feet on 03/21/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 1200 PM EDT.
